stitches.name: Chain
stitches.description: Foundation stitch for most crochet projects. Yarn over, pull through loop on hook.

stitches.name: Slip Stitch
stitches.description: Used to join rounds or move yarn without adding height. Insert hook, yarn over, pull through both loops.
stitches.notes: Keep tension loose to avoid puckering

stitches.name: Single Crochet
stitches.description: Basic stitch creating tight, dense fabric. Insert hook, yarn over, pull through, yarn over, pull through both loops.
stitches.notes: Great for amigurumi and sturdy fabrics

stitches.name: Half Double Crochet
stitches.description: Medium height stitch. Yarn over, insert hook, yarn over, pull through, yarn over, pull through all 3 loops.
stitches.notes: Nice drape, between sc and dc in height

stitches.name: Double Crochet
stitches.description: Tall stitch with nice drape. Yarn over, insert, yarn over, pull through, (yarn over, pull through 2) twice.
stitches.notes: Most common stitch for blankets and garments

stitches.name: Treble Crochet
stitches.description: Very tall stitch. Yarn over twice, insert, yarn over, pull through, (yarn over, pull through 2) three times.

stitches.name: Shell Stitch
stitches.description: Multiple stitches worked into the same stitch creating a fan/shell shape. Usually 5 dc in one stitch.
stitches.notes: Beautiful for shawls and blanket edges

stitches.name: Granny Square
stitches.description: Classic motif worked in rounds. Clusters of dc separated by chain spaces, creating a square.
stitches.notes: Perfect for using up scrap yarn

stitches.name: Bobble Stitch
stitches.description: Creates raised bumps. Work multiple incomplete dc in same stitch, then yarn over and pull through all loops.
stitches.notes: Uses more yarn but creates beautiful texture

stitches.name: V-Stitch
stitches.description: Creates V-shaped openwork. (dc, ch 1, dc) all in the same stitch or space.
